text: Hilton Curran (1914-1987) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s. Curran came to the St. George club via the Tumut rugby league football club.Tumut and Adelong Times 26/4/1938 Football Notes : https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/139300872?searchTerm=hilton%20curran&searchLimits;=l-decade=193|||l-year=1938. A talented winger with a turn of speed, Curran stayed one season with the Saints in 1938Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players, 1995. . He later served in Australian in the Army during World War Two WW2 Roll http://www.ww2roll.gov.au/Veteran.aspx?ServiceId=A&VeteranId;=358675. Curran died at Maroubra, New South Wales on 31 May 1987. Sydney Morning Herald - Death Notice 2/6/1987 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league wingers Category:1914 births Category:1987 deaths Category:Australian military personnel of World War II
title: Hilton Curran
